If they say 'ahora' (now), they mean sometime today. This isn't rudeness—it's just how time works here."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-amber-50 dark:bg-amber-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-amber-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","I learned this the hard way when I showed up 'on time' for a party at 9 PM. The hosts were still in their pajamas. The actual party started around 11. I sat on their couch for two hours pretending I wasn't incredibly awkward."]}]}]]}]}],["$","div","1",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"The 10 PM Dinner Reality"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Restaurants don't even get busy until 9:30 PM. Most Argentines eat dinner between 9 PM and 11 PM. If you're hungry at 6 PM, you're on your own—kitchens are often closed."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-amber-50 dark:bg-amber-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-amber-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","My first week, I tried to get dinner at 7 PM. The waiter looked at me like I'd asked for breakfast at midnight. He politely explained they were 'between services.' I ate empanadas from a kiosk and went to bed hungry."]}]}]]}]}],["$","div","2",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Siesta Is Real"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"From roughly 1 PM to 4 PM, many businesses close. Banks, government offices, and small shops shut down. Don't plan to get anything administrative done during these hours."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-amber-50 dark:bg-amber-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-amber-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","I once stood outside a bank for 30 minutes at 2 PM, checking my watch and getting increasingly frustrated, before a kind old lady told me they were closed for siesta. Men shake hands in very formal business settings, but among friends, everyone kisses."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-rose-50 dark:bg-rose-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-rose-400 mb-4","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","My first Argentine party, I stuck out my hand to shake. The woman looked confused, then laughed and kissed my cheek anyway. I spent the rest of the night overthinking every greeting. Now I default to the kiss—it's actually quite lovely once you get used to it."]}]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-start gap-2 text-sm","children":[["$","$L19",null,{"size":"sm","className":"text-amber-500 flex-shrink-0 mt-0.5"}],["$","span",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground","children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Pro tip:"}]," ","When in doubt, follow their lead. If they lean in, you lean in."]}]]}]]}]}],["$","div","1",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Mate Etiquette"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Mate is a shared drink passed in a circle. The cebador (server) fills it, drinks the first one (it's always bitter), then refills and passes. You drink the full gourd, then pass it back—don't say 'gracias' unless you want to stop drinking."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-rose-50 dark:bg-rose-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-rose-400 mb-4","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","I said 'thank you' after my first sip because I'm polite. The group went quiet. Someone explained that 'gracias' means 'I'm done, don't give me more.' I had to awkwardly ask to rejoin the mate circle. The shame still haunts me."]}]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-start gap-2 text-sm","children":[["$","$L19",null,{"size":"sm","className":"text-amber-500 flex-shrink-0 mt-0.5"}],["$","span",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground","children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Pro tip:"}]," ","Don't move the bombilla (metal straw). Don't stir it. Just drink and pass."]}]]}]]}]}],["$","div","2",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Asado Rules"}],"$L1a","$L1b","$L1c"]}]}],"$L1d","$L1e"]}]]}]}]}]

Direct refusals are considered rude."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-blue-50 dark:bg-blue-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-blue-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","A contractor told me 'sí, sí' to every request during a renovation. I thought everything was confirmed. Two weeks later, half the things hadn't happened. I learned to ask '¿Cuándo exactamente?' (When exactly?) and get specific dates."]}]}]]}]}],["$","div","1",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"'Maybe' Means 'No'"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"If someone says 'capaz' (maybe), 'veremos' (we'll see), or 'a ver' (let's see), they're almost certainly saying no in a polite way. Don't push—it won't change the answer."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-blue-50 dark:bg-blue-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-blue-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","I spent weeks following up on a 'maybe' business partnership. Every email got a 'we're considering it' response. Eventually, a friend told me I'd been rejected weeks ago. I just hadn't understood the code."]}]}]]}]}],["$","div","2",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"The Porteño Attitude"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Porteños (Buenos Aires locals) have a reputation for being a bit arrogant, sarcastic, and intellectually competitive. They'll debate anything, love wordplay, and take pride in their quick wit."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-blue-50 dark:bg-blue-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-blue-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","I got into a 'debate' about pizza at a dinner party. It started friendly, then got surprisingly intense. People were citing philosophers about cheese distribution. I realized this was sport, not argument. Now I enjoy the intellectual sparring."]}]}]]}]}],"$L1f"]}]]}]}]}]
d:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16 bg-muted/30","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-3 mb-8","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"w-12 h-12 rounded-full bg-green-100 dark:bg-green-900/30 flex items-center justify-center","children":["$","$L15",null,{"size":"lg","className":"text-green-600 dark:text-green-400"}]}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold","children":"Money & Tipping"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground","children":"How to handle cash, tips, and awkward money moments"}]]}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"space-y-6","children":[["$","div","0",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Tipping Culture"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"10% at restaurants is standard. It's not required everywhere—coffee shops, bars, and casual places often don't expect it. Some places include 'cubiertos' (cover charge) instead."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-green-50 dark:bg-green-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-green-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","I overtipped 20% at a cafe my first month, thinking I was being generous. The waiter looked confused and tried to give me change back. Now I keep it simple: 10% at restaurants, round up at cafes, nothing if there's a service charge."]}]}]]}]}],["$","div","1",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Propina vs Service Charge"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Check your bill. 'Servicio' or 'cubiertos' means a service charge is already included. 'Propina' is the voluntary tip. Don't double-tip unless the service was exceptional."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-green-50 dark:bg-green-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-green-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","I tipped on top of a service charge for months before someone pointed it out. I was basically paying 30% extra every meal. Check your bill carefully—it's usually itemized at the bottom."]}]}]]}]}],["$","div","2",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Cash Is King"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Despite being a modern city, Buenos Aires runs on cash—specifically US dollars. Many landlords prefer cash rent. Some restaurants offer discounts for cash. Credit cards often get you the official rate, which is worse."}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-green-50 dark:bg-green-950/20 p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-green-400","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm italic","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"font-semibold not-italic","children":"I learned this the hard way:"}]," ","I paid my first month's rent with a bank transfer because it seemed safer. My landlord was confused and slightly annoyed. Now I pay in crisp hundred-dollar bills like everyone else. It feels weirdly illicit but it's totally normal."]}]}]]}]}],"$L20"]}]]}]}]}]
e:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-3 mb-8","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"w-12 h-12 rounded-full bg-red-100 dark:bg-red-900/30 flex items-center justify-center","children":["$","$L16",null,{"size":"lg","className":"text-red-600 dark:text-red-400"}]}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold","children":"Safety & Street Smarts"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground","children":"Staying safe without being paranoid"}]]}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"space-y-6","children":[["$","div","0",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm border-red-200 dark:border-red-900/30","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-start gap-3 mb-2","children":[["$","$L21",null,{"size":"md","className":"text-red-500 flex-shrink-0"}],["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Phone in Pocket Rule"}]]}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Don't walk around with your phone in your hand. 23:["$","div","4",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-start gap-3 mb-2","children":[false,["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Common Scams"}]]}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Mustard/pigeon poop scams (distracting you while someone robs you), fake taxi overcharges, and the 'dropped money' trick are common.
